entries.meaning: A confused noise; turmoil; bustle; tumult.

verbs.description: pudder (third-person singular simple present pudders, present participle puddering, simple past and past participle puddered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To perplex; to embarrass; to confuse; to bother.
examples: that can be of no other use but to perplex and pudder him if he compares them

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To make a tumult or bustle; to splash; to make a pother or fuss.
examples: Others pudder into their food with their broad nebs.
